reviewText: First, this is a very EASY TO NAVIGATE DVD that lets you CHOOSE which exercise you want. Each mini session lasts no longer than 15 minutes, a plus when you are short on time! This Yoga in Bed DVD was purchased as an extra Yoga DVD. It is very relaxing and gentle and most of all FUN! It is wonderful for traveling, because all of the exercises can be done on the bed using pillows. Also, I find that it is very relaxing. This is NOT my main Yoga routine, I do this one at night for an EXTRA YOGA session. My regular ones are the Rodney Yee's series that I practice in the early morning. This is a wonderful program for a beginner that wishes to start with something GENTLE and SOOTHING or someone that does not wish to deal with having to buy a Yoga Mat, etc. Or someone like me who likes a gentle PM Yoga (after work) to wind down from the day. **As as added bonus, there is the extra section on the DVD that EXPLAINS each position throughly.
summary: A FUN AND RELAXED YOGA, FOR BEGINNERS--SO GENTLE!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have numerous health problems that make exercising very difficult. I've heard so much about Yoga that I finally broke down and tried it. I bought this DVD along with several others and couldn't wait to get started. Package arrives and I sit down to watch each DVD all the way through once. This DVD is way too easy even for someone with no Yoga experience whatsoever. In fact, after viewing it I discovered I've been doing many forms of Yoga already without even knowing it. I have OsteoArthritis, Fibromyalgia and Crohn's Disease and even I could do the routines on this DVD without much effort.There's nothing wrong with these stretching routines. In fact, if done regularly you will feel better mentally as well as physically. I've been doing most of them for years without knowing I was doing Yoga! And I'm still mobile because of it. If you can get a copy of this DVD from your local library I highly recommend it but I wouldn't recommend buying it. You'll be bored with it in a very short time and it will become just something else you have to dust. As for my copy, I passed it on to my niece. College life makes it hard for her to find time, or get instructions, for Yoga positions. This one will be easy for her to do in the dorm every day.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Being Disabled from Fibromyalgia, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, and Arthritis...I find very few forms of exercise work for me on a long term basis. In the nice weather I can walk or do a gentle moves class in the pool at a local Community Center but in the rainy, stormy weather I am lucky if I can get out of bed let alone be outdoors or even go to a heated pool. Yet I know when I feel the least like exercising because of pain...it is even more important than ever to make this body of mine move in order to keep my muscles from tightening, freezing-up and going into muscle spasms. I found that Yoga in Bed is a good way to get my body to cooperate with my goals no matter what the weather outdoors is like. This is an easy, gentle, go at your own speed and capability Yoga Session and a very relaxing way to keep those muscles stretched, warm and free moving in the soft comfort of your own bed. With the aid of your own mattress and a lot of soft pillows you will find yourself maneuvering to your own abilities and personal comfort level. Just 10 minutes in the morning and 10 minutes at night and you won't believe the benefits of this mind,body,spirit form of exercise and might I mention... it is not only from your own bed but in your own cozy, comfy pajamas. So,If you find that you are having a particularly difficult day and don't feel up to even getting out of bed...you just might feel up to it once you have done your 10 minute work out.Let me encourage you to at least give it a try! It just might make a major difference in your life too.  I am so glad that I bought this Video!  P. Smith
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wake up stiff in the morning and have a hard time going to sleep at night so this one caught my eye.  It is very basic, but thats not bad right before bedtime.  About 15 minutes of video to use before you get up and another before you go to sleep to stretch and release tension.  Crunch has one called Candle Light Yoga that is pretty good and much longer.  This is a perfect morning and bedtime quickie ;-)
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD stays true to it's title.There are two main menu options:Morning Poses: 16 min.: basic stretch, laying down spinal twist, knee to chest, knee to chest hip rolls (awesome!), back & forth on spine (good for warming up spine) head rolls, shoulder shrugs, shoulder rolls, chest stretch, seated spinal twist & then easing into the day.Eveing Poses: 12 min: rubbing 3rd eye, massaging scalp, 1 nostril breathing, seated spinal twist again, child's pose, laying down normal w/pillows behind back, laying down butterlfy, laying with legs against wall, pillow/easy seated chest to knee, diff laying down spinal twist, knee to chest roll, meditation for 2 min.Special Features:Morning or Evening Pose Reviews: You can choose/view each pose like a chapter choice.Lingering in Bed (same evening poses done longer): 20 min: Child's pose, laying on your back w/pillows to fall asleep at night, butterfly pose, legs up against a wall (for circulation), bedtime forward bend w/pillows on your thighs.FAQ: Very general questions asked of Edward Vilga.I took for a star as I was expecting more poses & more content, especially in the evening session.The only annoying thing is the menu options fade in/out which makes it change very slowly.If you do yoga at least semi regularly or somewhat flexible, this isn't for you unless the listed content above sounds like something to help you wake up or fall sleep.
summary: Great way to wake up for those out of shape, stiff in the morning or never stretch
